p: The dried seeds of nutmeg ( Myristica fragrans) were from Grenada. Seeds were identified by Jurga Bernatoniene, Medical Academy, Lithuania University of Health Sciences, Kaunas, Lithuania. A voucher specimen (I 18922) was placed for storage at the Herbarium of the Department of Drug Technology and Social Pharmacy. The seeds had a characteristic odor, a strong, bitter, and spicy flavour, and they were a brown-beige color. The seeds were ground into a powder (using laboratory mill), with particles smaller than 0.5 mm. All powder samples were kept in a dark and airtight container at 20 ± 2 °C.
